contentrichtext.text: '''Hélène Chalifour-Scherrer''', [[Queen's Privy Council for Canada|PC]] (born July 6, 1950 in [[Quebec City]], [[Quebec]]) is a [[Canada|Canadian]] politician. From 2000 to 2004, she was a [[Member of Parliament]] in the [[Canadian House of Commons|House of Commons]] representing [[electoral district (Canada)|riding]] of [[Louis-Hébert]], [[Quebec]], as a member of the [[Liberal Party of Canada]]. She has a [[Bachelor of Arts]] degree in [[social work]]. She has two children. In December 2003, she was appointed [[Minister of Canadian Heritage]] by the new prime minister, [[Paul Martin]]. In the [[Canadian federal election, 2004|2004 election]], she was defeated by [[Roger Clavet]] of the [[Bloc Québécois]], and replaced as heritage minister by [[Liza Frulla]] a month later. On August 18, 2004, it was announced that she was to become Paul Martin's principal secretary, replacing [[Francis Fox]]. She held this post until the defeat of the Martin government in 2006.
